title: Product Management
description: ðŸ“Š What is the MoSCoW framework for Product Management? ðŸŽ¯

words.fact: Must Have features are critical and non-negotiable for product launch. Without these, the project cannot succeed.
Should Have features are important but not vital. They can be delayed if necessary, though they add significant value.
Could Have features are desirable 'nice to haves'. They're included only if time and resources permit.
Won't Have features are explicitly excluded from current scope. This manages expectations and prevents scope creep.
